Operation 'jobsAll' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, missing_output_details. Original description is minimal and lacks context about pagination, filtering capabilities, and return structure. AI agents need to understand pagination support and available parameters to use this operation effectively.

data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve all jobs with pagination support
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all jobs in the ATS system. Supports filtering, sorting, and cursor-based pagination. Returns job objects containing details such as title, description, status, and associated metadata. Use cursor and limit parameters for pagination control.
data.reasoning: Original description is minimal and lacks context about pagination, filtering capabilities, and return structure. AI agents need to understand pagination support and available parameters to use this operation effectively.

message: Operation 'jobsOne' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, missing_output_details. Original description lacks specificity about what data is returned and what input is required. AI agents need clarity on the ID parameter requirement and the structure of returned job data.

data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve a specific job by ID
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed information for a specific job identified by its unique ID. Returns the complete job object including title, description, status, requirements, and associated metadata. Requires valid job ID as path parameter.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks specificity about what data is returned and what input is required. AI agents need clarity on the ID parameter requirement and the structure of returned job data.

message: Operation 'applicantsAll' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, missing_output_details. Original description is too minimal. AI agents need to understand pagination capabilities, what applicant data is returned, and how to navigate through results using cursor-based pagination.

data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve all applicants with pagination support
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all applicants in the ATS system. Supports filtering, sorting, and cursor-based pagination. Returns applicant objects containing profile information, contact details, and application history. Use cursor and limit parameters for pagination control.
data.reasoning: Original description is too minimal. AI agents need to understand pagination capabilities, what applicant data is returned, and how to navigate through results using cursor-based pagination.

message: Operation 'applicantsAdd' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original description lacks detail about required/optional fields, what the request body should contain, what is returned, and the side effect of creating a new record. data.description_suggestion: Creates a new applicant record in the ATS system. Accepts applicant details including name, contact information, and profile data in the request body. Returns the created applicant object with assigned unique ID and timestamps. The applicant becomes immediately available for job applications and tracking.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks detail about required/optional fields, what the request body should contain, what is returned, and the side effect of creating a new record. AI agents need this information to construct proper requests.

message: Operation 'applicantsOne' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, missing_output_details. data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve a specific applicant by ID
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed information for a specific applicant identified by their unique ID. Returns the complete applicant object including personal information, contact details, application history, and associated metadata. Requires valid applicant ID as path parameter.

message: Operation 'applicantsUpdate' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original description lacks detail about partial update support, what fields can be modified, what is returned, and the side effect of updating the record. AI agents need to understand that this is a PATCH operation supporting partial updates.

data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing applicant record identified by ID. Accepts partial applicant data in the request body - only provided fields will be modified. Returns the updated applicant object with modified fields and updated timestamp. Supports partial updates without requiring all fields.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks detail about partial update support, what fields can be modified, what is returned, and the side effect of updating the record. AI agents need to understand that this is a PATCH operation supporting partial updates.

message: Operation 'applicantsDelete' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original description lacks context about the permanent nature of deletion, what is returned, and the side effect of removing the applicant record. AI agents need to understand the destructive nature of this operation and what confirmation they receive.

data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes an applicant record identified by ID from the ATS system. Returns a confirmation response with the deleted applicant's ID. This action is irreversible and removes all associated applicant data. Requires valid applicant ID as path parameter.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks context about the permanent nature of deletion, what is returned, and the side effect of removing the applicant record. AI agents need to understand the destructive nature of this operation and what confirmation they receive.

data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve all applications with filtering and pagination
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all applications in the ATS system. Supports filtering by job, applicant, and status, as well as sorting and cursor-based pagination. Returns an array of application objects with metadata including pagination cursors for navigating through results.
data.reasoning: Original description is identical to summary and provides no actionable context. message: Operation 'applicationsAdd' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_context, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. data.description_suggestion: Creates a new application record in the ATS system, linking an applicant to a job opportunity. Accepts application details including applicant ID, job ID, and status. Returns the newly created application object with a unique identifier and timestamps. The application becomes immediately available for tracking and workflow management.

data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve a specific application by ID
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a single application record by its unique identifier. Returns the complete application object including applicant details, job information, status, and associated metadata. Use this operation to fetch detailed information about a specific application for review or updates.
data.reasoning: Original description provides no context about what is returned or how to use the operation. Enhanced description clarifies: (1) the operation retrieves a single record by ID, (2) the response includes related applicant and job data, (3) the use case for fetching detailed application information. message: Operation 'applicationsUpdate' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original description is too minimal for AI agent understanding. Enhanced description clarifies: (1) PATCH semantics for partial updates, (2) which fields can be modified, (3) that omitted fields are preserved, (4) response includes updated object, (5) side effects including workflow triggers. This helps agents understand update behavior and potential downstream effects.

data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing application record using partial update semantics (PATCH). Modifiable fields include status, notes, and other application-specific attributes. Only provided fields are updated; omitted fields remain unchanged. Returns the updated application object with current timestamps. Changes are immediately reflected in the ATS system and may trigger associated workflows.
data.reasoning: Original description is too minimal for AI agent understanding. Enhanced description clarifies: (1) PATCH semantics for partial updates, (2) which fields can be modified, (3) that omitted fields are preserved, (4) response includes updated object, (5) side effects including workflow triggers. This helps agents understand update behavior and potential downstream effects.

message: Operation 'applicationsDelete' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_context, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original description lacks critical context about permanence and side effects. Enhanced description clarifies: (1) the operation is permanent deletion, (2) the application is removed from the system, (3) response structure confirms deletion with ID, (4) potential side effects on related records and workflows. This helps AI agents understand the destructive nature and consequences of this operation.

data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes an application record from the ATS system by its unique identifier. This operation removes the application and associated data from the system. Returns a success confirmation with the deleted application's ID. Deletion is irreversible and may affect related records or workflows dependent on this application.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks critical context about permanence and side effects. Enhanced description clarifies: (1) the operation is permanent deletion, (2) the application is removed from the system, (3) response structure confirms deletion with ID, (4) potential side effects on related records and workflows. This helps AI agents understand the destructive nature and consequences of this operation.
